page.title: 02St.Mary Cray Parish Church.
page.content: he church is 735 years old.It is built out of flint.The church has got a spire at the west end.You enter the church through the porch that is on the south side.At the back of the church there is an old rood screen separating the tower from the nave.There are six bells in the tower. The oldest bell was cast in 1583.The church has a chapel on the south side. It is called the Hodsoll chapel after a local important family. There is a squint looking into the church.There are three sets of brasses.There is the Avery brass on the north side of the chancel,the Manning brass on the south side of the sanctuary and the Greenwood brasses in the middle of the chancel.The church is still in use today.
